title: Ticket #3284: Change default MODIFY_REQUEST_EXPR_REQUESTMEMORY
description:
At least at our CMS T2, the default MODIFY_REQUEST_EXPR_REQUESTMEMORY does more harm than good.

Right now, it is something like: quantize(RequestMemory, TotalCpus / TotalMemory / 4). This basically rounds-up to the nearest 25% of the per-slot memory. Two issues with this:

  • If the memory request is slightly more than the per-slot memory, this can cause significant loss.
    • Example: Suppose there are 32 slots and 2000 MB RAM per slot. If each job asks for 2001 MB, then the request is rounded to 2500 MB. So, a maximum of 25 jobs can be run - idling 7 cores instead of 1 core.
  • If there are many node types, then this is causing quite a bit of fragmentation of match lists. If you quantize based on the RequestMemory, you cause fragmentation of the auto-clusters. A priori, I don't really see any advantage based on using the per-slot memory size.

I propose we have a limit on the absolute amount of per-slot memory loss. Let's change the default to:

quantize(RequestMemory, 100)
remarks:
